content.title: Intro
content.content:
1966
Preceded by
1966
1967
Year
1968
Followed by
1968

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1967.

content.title: January
content.content:
Early - Joy Hill sends J.R.R. Tolkien a copy of The Children's Treasury of Literature.
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Otto B. Lindhardt.
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Peyton Moss.
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Joy Hill.
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 293b.
15 - Philip Norman's interview with J.R.R. Tolkien - is published in The Sunday Times Magazine and in The New York Times Magazine.

content.title: February
content.content:
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 294.
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to C.N. Manlove.
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to David L. Sands.
20 - Actress Katherine Soucie is born.
? - L. Sprague de Camp visits J.R.R. Tolkien.

content.title: March
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr.
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 294a.
9 - Actor Neil Kaplan is born.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 294b.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Humphrey Carpenter.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 295.
25 - The Scotsman publishes an interview of William Foster with J.R.R. Tolkien.

content.title: April
content.content:
12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 295a.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to J.D. Gilbert.
?21-28 - William Ready visits J.R.R. Tolkien sometime between these dates.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to John Leyerle.

content.title: May
content.content:
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Oscar Morland.
15 - Linguist Ivan Derzhanski is born.

content.title: June
content.content:
12 - Donald Swann and William Elvin record the music for The Road goes Ever On.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien records verses for the record Poems and Songs of Middle Earth.
29 - Gene Deitch's adaptation of The Hobbit is shown to a limited audience in New York City.

content.title: July
content.content:
12-13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 295b.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 296.
28 - The Ballad of Bilbo Baggins is performed by Leonard Nimoy in the TV-show Malibu U.

content.title: August
content.content:
1 - Actor Cameron Rhodes is born.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to a Mr Joukes.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 297.

content.title: September
content.content:
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 298.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Elsie Honeybourne.

content.title: October
content.content:
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Joy Hill.[1]
31 - The Road Goes Ever On, A Song Cycle is first published in the United States.

content.title: November
content.content: 9 - Smith of Wootton Major is first published in the UK.

content.title: December
content.content:
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 298a.
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Roger Verhulst.
7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr.
12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 299.
13 - Margaret Carroux comes to meet J.R.R. Tolkien in Oxford to talk about her German translation.
14 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rosfrith Murray.
16 - Miranda Otto, who portrayed Éowyn in The Lord of the Rings (film series), is born.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien and his wife went to see The Hobbit musical performance.
27 – Artist Josef Madlener dies.
30 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a a letter to Donald Swann.

Early 1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 293a.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the poem For W.H.A..
? - Artist Donato Giancola is born.
? - Author Elizabeth Currie is born.
? - Poems and Songs of Middle Earth is released.
? - Second edition of The Lord of the Rings is published by Houghton Mifflin.
? - Second printing of the second edition of the Lord of the Rings by Allen & Unwin, incorporating further changes.

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. xli
Years
1964 1965 1966 1967 1968 1969 1970
